title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 82.1 - Explosives
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 82.1 - Explosives

State Regulations
(a) Certificate of competence as blaster. A non-refundable fee of $120 shall accompany each
application to the Commissioner of Labor to take the exam for a certificate of
competence as a blaster. Upon passing the exam, the application fee shall be
applied towards the certificate of competence. Thereafter, a non-refundable fee
of $120, payable to the Commissioner of Labor, shall accompany each triennial
application for renewal of such certificate. (b) Certificate to keep or store
explosives. The following schedule of non-refundable fees is hereby
prescribed for a certificate to keep or store explosives, and for each annual
renewal thereof, required by subdivision 3 of section
458
of the Labor

Law: Blasting cap or detonator magazine
$ 5

Explosives magazines containing: less than 200 pounds
$ 5
200 pounds or more but less than 10,000 pounds
$10
10,000 pounds or more but less than 20,000
pounds
$15
20,000 pounds or more but less than 30,000
pounds
$20
30,000 pounds or more
$25

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
82.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
